comments.author: roopa
comments.content: I wish I had known about this when I went to Seattle last year - it sounds so good!
This is exciting!  We always bemoan the lack of good Mexican food in Seattle period, let alone veg for me.  We'll have to check it out!

comments.author: Tofu Mom
comments.content: WOW! Even better, these look like Street Food with Good VEGAN Options (depending on the ingredients in the bun of course!) Vegan Street Food. I must go right this very moment.

comments.author: Sorina
comments.content: Hi I am new to your blog and I just wanted to say how much I’m loving it

comments.author: Dan
comments.content: I wonder when food trucks, or any of the local vegetarian/vegan restaurants, are going to pick up on jackfruit as an option.  There's a food truck in southern california called Sea breeze that does amazing things with that amazing fruit.  Green jackfruit when cooked in a crock pot with any variety of sauces is amazing.  Plus, it's not a processed food stuff like tofu.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Dan - funny you should mention this, I've just recently become aware of the whole vegan jackfruit phenomenon. I've got a post coming up soon where I've found another non-traditional use for it besides pseudo-carnitas. Fun stuff!




Michael Natkin
